  sgcool_label_text: This photograph shows a man dressed in sarong kebaya and with a parasol in his hand. \r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a man dressed in sarong kebaya and with a parasol in his hand. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
